FORTHCOMINGMEETINGS item 0926-860X(93)80238-L 0926860X9380238L 1-s2.0-0926860X9380238L 10.1016/0926-860X(93)80238-L 271346 2024-01-01T12:21:46.509935Z 1993-08-31 1-s2.0-0926860X9380238L-main.pdf https://s3.amazonaws.com/prod-ucs-content-store-us-east/content/pii:0926860X9380238L/MAIN/application/pdf/bf83a2bb9a16f1c7484ee5b06b7c4e9a/main.pdf https://s3-eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/prod-ucs-content-store-eu-west/content/pii:0926860X9380238L/MAIN/application/pdf/bf83a2bb9a16f1c7484ee5b06b7c4e9a/main.pdf main.pdf pdf true 139219 MAIN 2 1-s2.0-0926860X9380238L-main_1.png https://s3-eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/prod-ucs-content-store-eu-west/content/pii:0926860X9380238L/PREVIEW/image/png/10c76d9d4159b3df49f1bad8d005ba31/main_1.png https://s3.amazonaws.com/prod-ucs-content-store-us-east/content/pii:0926860X9380238L/PREVIEW/image/png/10c76d9d4159b3df49f1bad8d005ba31/main_1.png main_1.png png 73099 849 656 IMAGE-WEB-PDF 1 N20 they lay down an organic film on surfaces including inside walls of vessel heaters and exchangers, but particularly on the surfaces of the reactive catalyst. This film retards penetration of oxygen to the underlying surfaces, so severely inhibiting oxidative reactions. Since 1986 the use of CATnap has grown in the Far East, especially Japan, and in 1992 CATnap was introduced into North America through a licensing arrangement with Catalyst Technology Inc. With its use 1.4 million lb of catalyst has been successfully unloaded under air atmosphere at four refineries. (Source: API Abstracts, Catalysts and Chemicals) EUROPA CAT-1 The following warning is given to participants in the final circular for EUROPA CAT1: "Climate: The average temperature in September is 25 (77). Heavy showers may occur. Do not forget your umbrella and your swimming costume." Are the showers so heavy? Forthcoming Meetings The Catalytica Studies Division will host its tenth annual Advances in Catalytic Technologies seminar on 17-19 October 1993, at the Hotel Sofitel San Francisco Bay in Redwood City, California. The seminar is organized into three sessions. The first session, Environmental Applications of Catalysis, includes presentations by Roger Sheldon (Delft Univ. of Technol.) on redox molecular sieves, Paul Schubert (Catalytica) on waste bromine recovery, James Spivey (Research Triangle Inst.) on catalytic oxidation for applied catalysis A: General VOC control, Ralph Dalla Betta (Catalytica) on "clean" catalytic combustion for ultralow emissions, and Richard Porcelli (Richard Porcelli Consultants) on process development for primary pollution control. Session 2, Science of Catalysis, features Bruce Gates (University of California, Davis), Lanny Schmidt (University of Minnesota), and Wayne Goodman (Texas A&M University). Session 3, Applications of Catalysis, includes presentations by James Lyons (Sun Refining and Marketing), Eric Derouane (Facultes Universitaires Notre Dame de la Paix, Namur) on the aromatization of light alkanes, and Joseph Floyd (Exxon Corp.) on metallocene catalysis for polyolefins. For more information, readers should contact Joe Naworski at the address given in the Calendar. From 17 to 21 October 1993, St. Petersburg will be the venue of the 4th European East-West Conference and Exhibition on Materials and Processes. The concept of this conference-exhibition on new materials and high technologies, with the extensive participation of materials science experts, technologists, engineers, designers, deciders of engineering policy and businessmen of Western and Eastern Europe, aims at setting up relations between these experts as well as increasing the scientific potential of West and East. Symposia held during the conference include topics such as Catalytic Materials and Coatings; Ceramic Materials, including those in the Automobile; Manufacturing Process Control, and Qualification of Advanced Materials; Materials under Extreme Conditions; Biomaterials; Optical Materials and Laser Technology for Telecommunications; as well as Materials for Cultural and Historical Herit- Volume 102 No. 2 - 31 August 1993 N21 age. The Catalytic Materials and Coating Symposium will be devoted to the application of new uncommon materials in catalysis, use of uncommon catalysts (cellular blocks, foam materials, coatings for chemical reactor vessels, etc.) in catalytic processes and the use of different types of waste to produce catalysts. The Ceramic Materials Symposium will cover the follow- ing topics: Ceramic Components in Batteries and Fuel Cells; Ceramic Sensors; Ceramic Actuators; Ceramics for use in Heat Engine Components; and Lifetime Prediction for the Performance of Ceramic Functional and Structural Components. Interested readers should contact the organization secretariat or the Eastern and Western chairpersons listed in the Calendar. Calendar of Forthcoming Events New Items For full Calendar see Appl.
